channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Somali day care centers face threats. And, how Trump could save Obamacare subsidies
item.description: Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Brain organoids are helping researchers, but their use also creates unease
item.description: Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits of gray matter.
item.content:encoded:
Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits of gray matter.

(Image credit: Institut Pasteur-SupBiotech/NASA)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned
item.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.

(Image credit: Miguel Vinas)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: With few Epstein files released, conspiracy theories flourish and questions remain
item.description: President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.

(Image credit: Staff)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali daycare owners, DOJ's initial release of Epstein files left many questions unanswered, dozens killed in Swiss Alps bar fire.
item.content:encoded: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali daycare owners, DOJ's initial release of Epstein files left many questions unanswered, dozens killed in Swiss Alps bar fire.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali day care owners
item.description: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.content:encoded: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: How the Trump administration's freeze on child care funding will affect families
item.description: NPR's A Martinez asks Cindy Lehnhoff, director of the National Child Care Association, about the Trump administration's freeze on federal funding to help low-income families pay for child care.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez asks Cindy Lehnhoff, director of the National Child Care Association, about the Trump administration's freeze on federal funding to help low-income families pay for child care.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Songwriter's son shares how fear over a shot created a sweet Disney musical classic
item.description: For StoryCorps, a reflection on how a child's vaccination fear sparked the creation of one of the most beloved songs in the movie, "Mary Poppins."
item.content:encoded: For StoryCorps, a reflection on how a child's vaccination fear sparked the creation of one of the most beloved songs in the movie, "Mary Poppins."
item.dc:creator: Jo Corona

item.title: A fire in a Swiss ski resort bar has left about 40 people dead
item.description: A New Year's party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, many in their teens to mid-20s.
item.content:encoded:
A New Year's party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, many in their teens to mid-20s.

(Image credit: Alessandro della Valle)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Taiwan's president pledges to defend island's sovereignty after Chinese military drills
item.description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te vowed to defend the self-ruled island's sovereignty in the face of what he termed China's "expansionist ambitions," days after Beijing wrapped up live-fire military drills near its shores.
item.content:encoded:
Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te vowed to defend the self-ruled island's sovereignty in the face of what he termed China's "expansionist ambitions," days after Beijing wrapped up live-fire military drills near its shores.

(Image credit: Taiwan Presidential Office)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
